alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for subscriptions and professional fees
overview: Tax and reporting rules for employers covering the costs of subscriptions and professional fees
title: Expenses and benefits: subscriptions and professional fees

table.body:
As an employer covering the cost of your employees' subscriptions and professional fees, you have certain tax, National Insurance and reporting obligations.

*[HMRC]:HM Revenue & Customs
table.title: Overview

table.body:
You don't have to report anything to HMRC or pay tax and National Insurance if all of the following apply:

* you pay the organisation yourself directly
* the organisation is on ['List 3',](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/list3/list3.htm "'List 3'"){:rel="external"} HMRC's list of approved professional bodies
* you have a [dispensation](/apply-for-a-dispensation "dispensation") covering the fees or subscription


*[HMRC]:HM Revenue & Customs
table.title: What's exempt

table.body:
If any of the subscriptions or fees you cover aren’t [exempt](/expenses-and-benefits-subscriptions-and-professional-fees/whats-exempt "exempt"), you may have to report the costs to HMRC, and you may have to deduct and pay tax and National Insurance on them.

##If you pay a 'List 3' organisation directly

^If you cover subscriptions or fees for an organisation included in ['List 3'](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/list3/list3.htm "'List 3'"){:rel="external"} by paying them directly, you can [apply for a dispensation](/apply-for-a-dispensation "apply for a dispensation"). This means you won’t have to include them on your end-of-year reports.^

The following table shows what you have to do if you don’t have a dispensation.

Who gets the benefit | What to do | What to deduct or pay
-|-|- 
Employees earning at a rate of up to £8,500 a year | Fill in form P9D, section A(2) | Nothing
Employees earning at a rate of £8,500 or more a year | Fill in form P11D, section M | Nothing
Directors | Fill in form P11D, section M | Nothing

##If you pay another organisation directly

If the organisation isn't included in ['List 3'](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/list3/list3.htm "'List 3'"){:rel="external"} add the cost of the fee or subscription to your employee's earnings when deducting Class 1 National Insurance (but not PAYE tax) through your payroll.

##If your employee pays the fee or subscription and you pay them back

If the organisation is included in ['List 3':](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/list3/list3.htm "'List 3'"){:rel="external"}

* add the cost of the fee or subscription to your employee's earnings
* deduct and pay PAYE tax (but not Class 1 National Insurance) through your payroll

If the organisation isn't included in ['List 3':](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/list3/list3.htm "'List 3'"){:rel="external"}

* add the cost of the fee or subscription to your employee's earnings
* deduct and pay PAYE tax and Class 1 National Insurance using through your payroll

*[HMRC]:HM Revenue & Customs
*[PAYE]: Pay As You Earn
